title: Driver crashed into parked car while trying to catch a spider
text:
The accident happened on the westbound carriageway of the A50 on Sunday, October 20, and led to major tailbacks (Picture: Derbyshire RPU / SWNS)

A panicked driver crashed into a parked car after taking his eyes off the road because of a spider.

Derbyshire Police shared pictures of the wrecked cars after the crash which left both drivers suffering minor injuries.

The driver of a silver Citroen Saxo ploughed into a red car which was parked in a layby on the A50 in Derbyshire.

Derbyshire Roads Policing Unit tweeted: ‘A50 Westbound on Sunday.

‘No doubt some of you got caught up in the tailbacks from this collision.

‘Silver car driver trying to catch a spider whilst driving collides with red car in layby.

‘Minor injuries. Reported for driving without due care and attention.’

Social media users were quick to share their reaction to the crash.

Graham Galloway tweeted: ‘Hope the spider was ok?’

Another was more scathing and wrote: ‘If he is so stupid as to try to catch a spider and cause that amount of damage to both vehicles, he is too stupid to be allowed to continue to drive.

‘Due Care and attention doesn’t even begin to approach the imbecility.’

On Facebook a user wrote: ‘I’m guessing the driver told police he was an incy wincy distracted by the spider. Either that or he was spinning them a line’.

description: Social media users were left wondering if the spider was OK.
